events.name: Butcher, Witch, & Wolf: The Werewolf Trials of Europe with Zee Kay
events.description: Europe's Werewolf Trials paralleled the more infamous Witch Trials in the 15th - 17th century, yet the confessions of accused werewolves were even more bizarre, including lurid tales of bestiality, cannibalism, serial killing, and deals with a shapeshifting Devil. Come explore how the Church integrated pre-Christian folk beliefs into its cosmology to construct a new category of witchcraft: the witch as wild animal, an uncivilized and uncivilizing force that represented the perils of life away from religion.

events.name: The Taxil Hoax and the Making of Modern Religious Panic with Hadrian Flyte
events.description: How the Taxil Hoax in the 19th century laid the groundwork for ongoing conspiracy theory outrage and how early Catholic panic over Freemasonry set the world on fire.

events.name: Whimsical Blasphemy
events.description: Music and Videos with Mercy, live from Salem
